babble.net

Class NetworkBuffer

  • java.lang.Object
    • babble.net.NetworkBuffer
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    Request, Response

    public class NetworkBuffer
extends Object
    A buffer for data to be written on a network channel. An user can write byte, byte array, multi-byte data (e.g. integer or long) and character-oriented data such as string. This facility can also stream data (in chunks) when number of bytes is not a priori determinable.
    The byte-oriented data is read and written through read*() and write* methods.
    A buffer must be attached to a communication channel before data can be sent to a remote process. The communication channel is set on this buffer either at construction or explicitly later.
    Because this facility use internal buffers to lower network i/o, it is important to flush to end communication, otherwise data that have been written may remain in buffer and not sent to remote process.
    Author:
    pinaki poddar

    • Method Detail

      • setChannel

        protected void setChannel(ByteChannel channel)
        Sets a network channel where response data will be written. A channel must be set either at construction or by this method before write*() operation. The write*() operations do not immediately write data to a channel, but they might flush when intermediate buffer fills up and would require a channel.
        Parameters:
        channel - a network channel

      • getChannel

        protected final ByteChannel getChannel()
        Gets the channel on which this request had been received. Can be null.
